plugin.name: DeadLetter
plugin.author: Ruhsbaar_and_Tuppy
plugin.purpose: Identify the target of Dead Letter missions

local all = {difficult_customer, distant_land, far_away, close_by, local_} local list_names = { [difficult_customer] = "diff", [distant_land] = "dist", [far_away] = "far", [close_by] = "close", [local_] = "local", }
------------------------------------------------- -- When plugin is loaded, replace brackets in names with bold and unbold ansi codes. local function AnsiStyleScryName(s, normalAnsi, scryAnsi) s = string.gsub(s, "[%[]", scryAnsi) s = string.gsub(s, "[%]]", normalAnsi) return s end
local normalAnsi = ANSI(22) -- Undo bold local scryAnsi = ANSI(1) -- Bold
for i,list in ipairs(all) do for k,data in pairs(list) do data[1] = AnsiStyleScryName(data[1], normalAnsi, scryAnsi) end end -------------------------------------------------
local address_lines = {} local search_results = {} local overload_line_count = 8 -- The plugin always stops after this many lines. local line_count = 0 local end_line_text = "Written in hastily scrawled text:" -- Prints result after one line after this text. local waiting = false
local function ClearTable(t) for k,v in pairs(t) do t[k] = nil end end
local testLetter = { --"_________i", "__o_____", "______la___c", "_h__A_a_e_____p__e", }
function DeadLetterTest() ColourNote("silver", "", "You read the letter:\nWritten in scribbled handwriting:") for i,v in ipairs(testLetter) do address_lines[i] = v ColourNote("silver", "", v) end Note() ColourNote("silver", "", end_line_text) ColourNote("silver", "", "Deliver by Wed Feb 13 16:10:01 2019 [EST].") DeadLetterSolution() ClearTable(address_lines) end
function DeadLetterStart(sName, sLine, wildcards) waiting = false ClearTable(address_lines) line_count = 0 EnableTrigger("DeadLetterCaptureLine", true) EnableTrigger("DeadLetterCaptureError", true) EnableTrigger("DeadLetterCaptureCombatError", true) end
function DeadLetterStop(sName, sLine, wildcards) EnableTrigger("DeadLetterCaptureLine", false) EnableTrigger("DeadLetterCaptureError", false) EnableTrigger("DeadLetterCaptureCombatError", false) if address_lines[1] then DeadLetterSolution() ClearTable(address_lines) end end
function DeadLetterParse(sName, sLine, wildcards) line_count = line_count + 1 if waiting then DeadLetterStop() elseif line_count >= overload_line_count then DeadLetterStop() elseif sLine == end_line_text then waiting = true elseif string.match(sLine, "_") then table.insert(address_lines, sLine) end end
local function checkName(regex, name, data) if regex:match(name) then if type(data) ~= "table" then Note("ERROR: 'data' is not a table, it's a '" .. type(data) .. "'.") else return true end end end
local function getListNameString(list) local s = list_names[list] if not s then Note("Error: getListNameString() - Unrecognized list '" .. tostring(list) .. "'.") s = "" end s = string.format("[%s] ", s) return s end
function DeadLetterSolution() local name_line = address_lines[1] if name_line then local name_regex = rex.new("^".. string.gsub(name_line, "_", ".") .. "$")
ClearTable(search_results) local resultCount = 0
-- Check name line against all people for all letter types. for i,list in ipairs(all) do for name,data in pairs(list) do if checkName(name_regex, name, data) then table.insert(search_results, {name = name, data = data, list = list}) resultCount = resultCount + 1 end end end -- If there are multiple results, try to narrow it down by subsequent lines. if resultCount > 1 then local discardStr = "" if #address_lines > 1 then local city_line = address_lines[2] -- Second line more reliable than last. (?) for i=#search_results, 1, -1 do local v = search_results[i] name = v.name local city_regex = rex.new(string.gsub(city_line, "_", ".")) if not city_regex:match(v.data[2]) then local ls = getListNameString(v.list) discardStr = discardStr .. ls .. name .. ", " table.remove(search_results, i) end end end if string.len(discardStr) > 0 then discardStr = " " .. resultCount .. " Results found. Discarded: " .. string.sub(discardStr, 1, -3) Note(discardStr) end elseif resultCount == 0 then Note("Sorry, couldn't find a match for: '" .. tostring(name_line) .. "'.") return end
-- Print all results. for i,v in pairs(search_results) do local s = getListNameString(v.list) .. table.concat(v.data, ", ") AnsiNote(s) end end end
muclient.triggers: <trigger enabled="n" ignore_case="n" keep_evaluating="y" match="(?P.+)" regexp="y" script="DeadLetterParse" sequence="35" name="DeadLetterCaptureLine" >
